alert.note: Alert for Mora; San Miguel; Taos (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 08 at 3:00PM MDT until August 08 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE HERMITS PEAK CALF CANYON BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTH CENTRAL TAOS, WESTERN MORA AND NORTHWESTERN SAN MIGUEL COUNTIES... At 300 PM MDT, Emergency management and first responders reported flash flooding and debris flows within the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon wilfire Burn Scar. A rock slide has occurred along NM Highway 121, and portions of NM Highway 518 near Holman are also impassable due to debris flows. Between 0.75 and 2 inches of rain is estimated to have fallen and excessive runoff and debris flows will remain a threat through the next few hours. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall from earlier slow-moving thunderstorms has produced flash flooding and debris flows around the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon Burn Scar. SOURCE...Emergency management and first responders reported. IMPACT...Excessive runoff, life threatening flash flooding and debris flows in and around the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mora, Ledoux, Morphy Lake State Park, Cleveland, Tierra Monte, La Cueva, Holman, Gascon, Sapello, Chacon, South Carmen, Monte Aplanado, Luceros, Rainsville, Rociada, Manuelitas, Golondrinas, El Turquillo, San Ignacio in Guadalupe County and Guadalupita. This includes the following recreation areas... Morphy Lake State Park. This includes the following highways... State Road 94 between Mile Markers 1 and 18. State Road 266 between Mile Markers 0 and 6. State Road 276 between Mile Markers 0 and 5. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 9 and 47. State Road 434 between Mile Markers 0 and 15. State Road 283 near Mile Marker 13. State Road 105 between Mile Markers 0 and 9. State Road 121 between Mile Markers 0 and 8. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon wildfire burn area. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
